channel.title: USPTO Other Events
channel.description: This feed provides easy access to USPTO Other events.

item.title: APP-LY YOURSELF: A coding program to support the 2022 Congressional App Challenge
Successful inventing: What inventors need to know
item.description: Are you new to the invention process? If so, register today for the first event in the Successful inventing series, presented by the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) and the Licensing Executives Society - Silicon Valley Chapter (LES-SVC).

item.title: 2023 National Patent Application Drafting Competition overview webinar
item.description: The United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) invites law students studying patent law to participate in the 2023 National Patent Application Drafting Competition. The competition introduces students to issues arising in U.S. patent law and develops their patent application drafting, amending, and prosecution skills.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: USC 101 patent eligibility in blockchain
item.description: Claims define the boundaries of intellectual property just as property lines define the boundaries of a house. Over the past few years, USC 101 has been clarified regarding patent eligibility as inventions in the digital space because they do not always produce tangible end results.

item.title: Innovating ideas around standard essential patents
Blockchain & IP: USC 101 patent eligibility in blockchain
item.description: Claims define the boundaries of intellectual property just as property lines define the boundaries of a house. Over the past few years, USC 101 has been clarified regarding patent eligibility as inventions in the digital space because they do not always produce tangible end results.

item.title: Fundamentos de la propiedad intelectual
item.description: ¿Desea familiarizarse con las patentes, las marcas registradas, los derechos de autor, y los secretos comerciales? De ser así, le invitamos para que aprenda acerca de los fundamentos básicos de la propiedad intelectual (PI) y las formas potenciales de proteger sus innovaciones durante su transición de una idea al producto.

item.title: Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
Intellectual property (IP) workshop for K-12 educators
SOaR presents 'Joint Voices' training and IP education seminar: Featuring highlights from the USPTO Midwest Regional Office
item.description: Are you interested in learning about your intellectual property (IP) rights? Do you have an idea and want to know how to protect it? Register today to learn the basics of patents, trademarks, and copyrights during the Stakeholder Offerings and Resources (SOaR) program's first Joint Voices outreach webinar event on Tuesday, October 25, from 1-3 p.m. ET.

item.title: China IP: Quarterly legislation and case law update
K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
K-12 IP education office hours
PTAB Inventor Hour - Episode 13
item.description: Are you an inventor or new to Patent Trial and Appeal Board (PTAB) proceedings?

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: Intellectual property basics and helpful resources
item.description: Unfamiliar with patents, trademarks, copyrights, and trade secrets? Don't miss this opportunity to learn from United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) experts about intellectual property (IP) basics and potential ways to protect your innovation as you transition from idea to product.

item.title: One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 3 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT at Cossatot Community College in De Queen, Arkansas. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.

item.title: Webinar on the Request for Comments on Initiatives to Ensure the Robustness and Reliability of Patent Rights
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) on Friday, November 4, 1-2 p.m. ET, for a webinar on the recently issued Request for Comments (RFC) on Initiatives to Ensure the Robustness and Reliability of Patent Rights. The RFC seeks input on a variety of topics including:

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: Trademark Public Advisory Committee quarterly meeting
item.description: Attend the next quarterly meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Trademark Public Advisory Committee (TPAC) to learn more about trademark-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The TPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: International perspectives: Intellectual property, small and medium-sized enterprises, and global markets
item.description: Join the leaders of the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO), the European Patent Office (EPO), and the Japan Patent Office (JPO) for both an in-person and virtual discussion about the importance of intellectual property (IP) and of making the patent system more accessible to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs).

item.title: LEAP to Chambers
item.description: Join the Patent Trial and Appeal Board's (PTAB) Legal Experience and Advancement Program (LEAP) for its brand new event, LEAP to Chambers! This event will take place on Wednesday, November 9, 2022, from 10 a.m. to noon.

item.title: One-day patents boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day patents boot camp on November 14 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT at The Little Brick Church in Oneonta, Alabama. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and inventors in communities with limited or no internet access, covering tools, techniques, and resources to understand the patent application process.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Stakeholder spotlight
item.description: Hear about the innovations and inventions in supply chain management, credit cards, insurance, and banking that companies along the United States Eastern seaboard are pursuing. These real-world use cases will delight and inspire your outlook of the future.

item.title: Blockchain & IP: Stakeholder spotlight
item.description: Hear about the innovations and inventions in supply chain management, credit cards, insurance, and banking that companies along the United States Eastern seaboard are pursuing. These real-world use cases will delight and inspire your outlook of the future.

item.title: Patent Public Advisory Committee public meeting
item.description: Attend the next public meeting of the United States Patent and Trademark Office's (USPTO) Patent Public Advisory Committee (PPAC) to learn more about patent-related policies, goals, performance, budgets, and user fees. The PPAC advises the Under Secretary of Commerce for Intellectual Property and Director of the USPTO. The public meeting agenda will be available one week before the scheduled meeting.

item.title: One-day trademarks boot camp
item.description: Join the United States Patent and Trademark Office (USPTO) for a one-day trademarks boot camp on November 21 from 9 a.m. to 5 p.m. CT at The Little Brick Church in Oneonta, Alabama. This is an in-person, single-day workshop for entrepreneurs, small businesses, and start-ups in communities with limited or no internet access, covering what they should know about trademarks.
